MetaStan 0.1.0
  • Reference
  • Articles
    • Conducting meta-analysis using MetaStan

Prepare model-based meta-analysis dataset for Stan.

Source: R/create_MBMA_dat.R
create_MBMA_dat.Rd

create_MBMA_dat converts datasets in the one-study-per-row format to one-arm-per-row format,

create_MBMA_dat(dat = dat, armVars = c(dose = "t", responders = "r",
  sampleSize = "n"), nArmsVar = "nd")

Arguments

dat

Data in one-study-per-row format.
armVars

Vector of per-arm variables The name of each component will be the column name in the resulting dataset.
nArmsVar

Variable holding the number of arms for each study.

Value

A data frame with the generated coloumns.

Details

The resulting data.frame can be used as data argument in MBMA_stan.

See also

gemtc::mtc.data.studyrow and nmaINLA::create_INLA_dat

Examples

data('dat.Eletriptan')
## Create the dataset suitable for MBMA_stan
EletriptanDat <- create_MBMA_dat(dat = dat.Eletriptan,
armVars = c("dose" = "d", "r" = "r", "n" = "n"), nArmsVar = 'nd')
## Check that the data are correct
print(EletriptanDat)
